result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry Lee Bland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: COSTS TO APPLY TO BOTH COUNTS ONE AND TWO:  Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim witness surcharges, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by DOC. To be paid during period of Extended supervision or civil judgment.

Defendant shall provide a DNA  sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Obtain GED/HSED.  Obtain and maintain employment.

No drugs or alcohol.
No contact with victim Deborah E.
No firearms, weapons.

Successfully complete Batterers Intervention counseling or anger management and continue programming.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment. Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.  Maintain absolute sobriety.

Hearing 10/28/2014
***hearing 11/11/2014; restitution set at zero (0)/Judge Flanagan, Amend JOC.***

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.  Huber privileges for work and/or treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Martin R. Tanz in court, defendant Henry Lee Bland not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.\
 Off the record.  Restitution hearing proceeded.  No restitution was requested by the victim, per ADA Heitman.  Court ordered Restitution set at zero.   mld
Request for payment of $34.00 witness fees for witness Deberah E. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request X26204502 in court 2x 08/25/14,09/11/14.

Attorney Martin R. Tanz in court, defendant Henry Lee Bland not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant was not produced for today's proceedings. Per the State, the victim was noticed for today's hearing, but notice stated Review hearing and not Restitution Hearing.  Court ordered Restitution hearing adjourned to 11-11-2014 at 8:30 am, Branch 4.  Defendant to be produced for next court date.  mld
Witness fee request prepared for Deberah E. was approved for 2 appearances on 8/25/14 and 9/11/14  by the DAs Victim/Witness Services.
To Br. 4.
Per Order signed on today's date:  Count one corrected to read sentence was imposed and stayed, placed on probation for two (2) years.

Correcting Sentence and Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.
-- IT IS HEREBY ORDERED that the judgment of conviction shall reflect that the sentence was imposed and stayed in favor of two years of probation on count one.  mld
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mel Flanagan, Br. 4, for review. jbs
Partial transcript of sentencing from September 11, 2014, received and filed.
Letter from defendant seeking correction to sentence structure.
Witness fee request prepared for Deberah E. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
Count one.
Count two.

Defendant Henry Lee Bland in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Defendant Henry Lee Bland in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 The Hon. Dennis Flynn for the Hon. Mel Flanagan.
Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:Statements made as to sentencing.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Deberah E. 

 AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 5 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  Huber privileges for work and/or treatment.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of THREE YEARS AND 6 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), with credit for 165 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is ONE YEAR AND 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION: 
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling OR Anger Management, and continue programming.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, Deberah E. 
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by
   the Department of Corrections, during period of 
   extended supervision or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
    ---- costs apply to both counts #1 and #2. 
* Restitution Hearing scheduled 
   for 10-28-2014 at 1:30 pm, Br. 4.  
* Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Extended Supervision.

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1 and COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 9-11-2014 at 1:30 pm.  Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 8-25-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Defendant Henry Lee Bland in court with attorney Martin R. Tanz.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 "On states motion, Court AMENDED the Charge of COUNT #1 to Felony Theft, contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 943.20(1)(a), a Class I Felony."   
State will file an Amended Information on the next court date.   mld
Attorneys Heitman and Tanz were present to set case for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 8-25-2014 at 8:30 am.  Court maintains the Jury Trial date of 8-25-2014 at 8:30 am, Branch 4.  mld

Attorney Martin R Tanz in court, defendant Henry Lee Bland not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court waived the appearance of defendant upon the request of defense counsel.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  DEMAND for Speedy Trial entered by defense counsel.  Cae adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 8-25-2014 at 8:30 am.   mld

Attorney Martin R Tanz in court, defendant Henry Lee Bland not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 New defense counsel has received the majority of the discovery and has an offer.  More discovery will be forthcoming to defense counsel, per the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-4-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Defendant Henry Lee Bland in court with attorney Donald C Dudley.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Defense counsel advised the Court that he had previously represented the victim on a CHIPS action, and therefore, will need to withdraw as defense counsel.   

Defense motion to withdraw as counsel is heard and granted by the court. Defense counsel will notify the Public Defender's Office to appoint new counsel for the defendant.  Case adjourned for Status Conference in Branch 4 on 5-19-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession or use of controlled substance without a valid prescription, no firearms/dangerous weapons and defendant is not allowed in the vicinity of the 800 block of North 23rd Street.   mld

Defendant Henry Lee Bland in court with attorney Donald C Dudley.  Defendant Henry Lee Bland in custody.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Alvin Hannah.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Court heard and granted defense motion to correct a scribner's error on the Original information, as to the date of birth for defendant.  Court amended the Original information to reflect that the correct date of birth for defendant is 3-28-1957.  The  Original information received and filed, with the corrected date of birth, defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of the discovery from the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 4-30-2014 at 1:30 pm.  

Defense motion to modify bail is heard and granted by the Court.   mld

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DEBERAH E.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Henry Lee Bland in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Henry Lee Bland in custody.  Dennis P. Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FLANAGAN, Branch 4.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 4.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
